author: wsjcom
title: A Tunnel Vision Essential for Infrastructure
text:
Rep. Ted Budd’s “The Northeast’s Costly Tunnel Vision” (op-ed, March 8) offers readers a shortsighted view of commerce and trade in this country. Rep. Budd’s commentary ignores that the Hudson Tunnel Project proposal is a crucial infrastructure project for the entire nation. It is not a project benefiting only New York and New Jersey, as suggested by Rep. Budd, but a critical link in America’s infrastructure and economy. Nineteen states, including North Carolina, realize the benefits of the shipment of passengers and freight up and down the Northeast Corridor (NEC) rail line.
